00034 #include "config_dap.h"

00036 static char rcsid[] not_used = {"$Id$"};

00044 #include "Error.h"

00046 #include "parser.h"

00050 #ifdef WIN32
00051 using std::cerr;
00052 using std::endl;
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 // These macros are used to access the `arguments' passed to the parser. A
00056 // pointer to an error object and a pointer to an integer status variable are
00057 // passed in to the parser within a strucutre (which itself is passed as a
00058 // pointer). Note that the ERROR macro explicitly casts OBJ to an ERROR *. 
00059 
00060 #define ERROR_OBJ(arg) ((Error *)((parser_arg *)(arg))->_object)
00061 #define STATUS(arg) ((parser_arg *)(arg))->_status
00062 
00063 #define YYPARSE_PARAM arg
00064 
00065 extern int error_line_num;  // defined in Error.lex
00066 
00067 int Errorlex();         // the scanner
00068 void Errorerror(char *s);   // gotta love automatically generated names...
00069 
00070 %}
00071 
00072 %union {
00073 #ifdef __SUNPRO_CC
00074     int boolean;
00075 #else
00076     bool boolean;
00077 #endif
00078     int integer;
00079     char *string;
00080 }
00081 
00082 %token <integer>    SCAN_INT
00083 %token <string>     SCAN_STR
00084 
00085 %token <integer>    SCAN_ERROR
00086 %token <integer>    SCAN_CODE
00087 %token <integer>    SCAN_PTYPE
00088 %token <string>     SCAN_MSG
00089 %token <string>     SCAN_PROGRAM
00090 
00091 %type <boolean> error_object contents description program
00092 %type <boolean> code program_type message program_code
00093 
00094 %%
00095 
00096 // The parser is called through a function named ERRORPARSE which takes a
00097 // pointer to a structure and returns a boolean. The structure contains a
00098 // pointer to an Error object which is empty and an integer which contains
00099 // status information. In addition the parser_arg strucuture contains a
00100 // pointer to an error object. However, the `error' member of parser_arg is
00101 // not yet used here.
00102 
00103 error_object:   SCAN_ERROR '{' contents '}' ';' { $$ = $3; STATUS(arg) = $3; }
00104 ;
00105 
00106 contents:   description program { $$ = $1 && $2; }
00107                 | description { $$ = $1; }
00108 ;
00109 
00110 description:    code message { $$ = $1 && $2; }
00111                 | code { $$ = $1; }
00112 ;
00113 
00114 program:    program_type program_code { $$ = $1 && $2; }
00115 ;
00116 
00117 code:       SCAN_CODE '=' SCAN_INT ';' 
00118         { 
00119             ERROR_OBJ(arg)->set_error_code((ErrorCode)$3);
00120             $$ = true; 
00121         }
00122 ;
00123 
00124 message:    SCAN_MSG '=' SCAN_STR 
00125         { 
00126             ERROR_OBJ(arg)->set_error_message($3);
00127             $$ = true; 
00128         } 
00129         ';' 
00130 ;
00131 
00132 program_type:   SCAN_PTYPE '=' SCAN_INT ';'
00133         {
00134             ERROR_OBJ(arg)->set_program_type((ProgramType)$3);
00135             $$ = true; 
00136         }
00137 ;
00138 
00139 program_code:   SCAN_PROGRAM '=' SCAN_STR
00140         {
00141             DBG(cerr << "Program: " << $3 << endl);
00142             ERROR_OBJ(arg)->set_program($3);
00143             $$ = true; 
00144         }
00145         ';' 
00146 ;
00147 
00148 %%
00149 
00150 void
00151 Errorerror(char *s)
00152 {
00153   string msg = s;
00154   msg += " line: ";
00155   append_long_to_string(error_line_num, 10, msg);
00156   msg += "\n";
00157 
00158   throw Error(unknown_error, msg);
00159 }
